content:
At Coinbase, our mission is to increase economic freedom around the world, and we couldn’t do this without hiring the best people. We’re a group of hard-working overachievers who are deeply focused on building the future of finance and Web3 for our users across the globe, whether they’re trading, storing, staking or using crypto. Know those people who always lead the group project? That’s us.
There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we look for candidates who will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, and disrupt ourselves. Second, we expect all employees to commit to our mission-focused approach to our work. Finally, we seek people who are excited to learn about and live crypto, because those are the folks who enjoy the intense moments in our sprint and recharge work culture. We’re a remote-first company looking to hire the absolute best talent all over the world.
Ready to #LiveCrypto? Who you are:

You’ve got positive energy. You’re optimistic about the future and determined to get there. 
You’re never tired of learning. You want to be a pro in bleeding edge tech like DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, and Web 3.0. 
You appreciate direct communication. You’re both an active communicator and an eager listener - because let’s face it, you can’t have one without the other. You’re cool with candid feedback and see every setback as an opportunity to grow.
You can pivot on the fly. Crypto is constantly evolving, so our priorities do, too. What you worked on last month may not be what you work on today, and that excites you. You’re not looking for a boring job.
You have a “can do” attitude. Our teams create high-quality work on quick timelines. Owning a problem doesn’t scare you, but rather empowers you to take 100% responsibility for achieving our mission.
You want to be part of a winning team. We’re stronger together, and you’re a person who embraces being pushed out of your comfort zone. 
To strengthen our growing Enterprise Applications and Architecture (EAA) team, we are looking for an Integration Engineer Intern, passionate about transforming technology into critical business value. You will synthesize a product vision into key technical decisions and partner with Business Units and engineering teams to buy, build, launch, and scale platforms. You will report to Senior Manager (Enterprise Integrations), and be part of the larger Coinbase Enterprise Applications and Architecture Organization.
What you’ll be doing (ie. job duties):

Design and build integrations for Coinbase Enterprise Apps using approved integration patterns and design principles.
Collaborate with integration engineering and product managers to understand functional requirements and create technical solutions.
Improve integration build solutions to address architectural or security gaps as well as address technical debt.
Drive and manage creation of standards, integration best-practices and methodologies for the team
Participate in major cross-functional efforts end to end, working with multiple business units to deliver best in class integration solutions.
Check in and deploy code and configurations; participate in release management
Deliver/Execute with a team of solution architects, program managers and engineers.
Produce documentation and tutorials that enable other teams and participate in bi-weekly technical demo sessions.
Collaborate with external vendors for integration using APIs and File Based systems.
Be on rotation duty for product support, troubleshoot, mitigate and triage prod incidents as they occur.

What we look for in you (ie. job requirements):

Good knowledge of building web services using REST APIs, or other similar protocols like GRPC or SOAP.
Experience working with ETL tools such as Apache Airflow (or similar) for synchronizing huge data volumes between systems, connecting APIs and databases
Good knowledge of CI/CD processes with experience using Maven, MUnits, GitHub and deployments on K8s and docker containers run on AWS EC2 Instances.
Good communication skills and ability to grasp requirements and work independently in an agile working environment.
Experience delivering API integration solutions with internal or external systems, e.g. Salesforce, NetSuite, Workday and other legacy and cloud-based solutions.

Nice to haves:

Degree or currently pursuing a degree in computer science.
Experience in software development with proficiency in one or more object oriented programming languages i.e. Core Java, Python or Go Lang.
Experience working with middleware/iPaaS tools e.g.Workato, MuleSoft, Boomi etc.
Experience working with AWS Services i.e. S3, SQS, SNS, EC2, ELBs.
